description: Before everyone fishes, there are 100 tons of fish in the lake.
Kate wanted to catch 20 tons of fish, and caught 20 tons.

The group of fishers, led by John, agreed to set a collective limit of 50 tons per month, with each person catching around 10 tons, to ensure the long-term sustainability of the lake's fish population.
conversation: Ladies and gentlemen, let me give you the monthly fishing report. John caught 8 tons of fish. Kate caught 20 tons of fish. Jack caught 20 tons of fish. Emma caught 15 tons of fish. Luke caught 15 tons of fish.

Hey everyone, I think we need to talk about how much we're catching. If we keep taking out this many fish each month, the lake won't be able to sustain us for long. Maybe we should agree on a limit that ensures the fish population can recover and we can all keep making money in the long run.

I agree with John. If we keep catching this many fish, we might deplete the lake's resources. How about we set a collective limit of 50 tons per month? That way, we can ensure the fish population has a chance to recover and we can all benefit in the long run.

I think Kate's suggestion makes sense. If we set a collective limit of 50 tons per month, that means each of us would need to catch around 10 tons. It might be a bit of a sacrifice in the short term, but it could help us all in the long run. What do you all think?

I think Jack's right. If we each catch around 10 tons, it might be tough at first, but it will help the lake recover and ensure we can keep fishing in the future. I'm willing to commit to catching only 10 tons next month. What about you, Luke?

I agree with all of you. It's important that we think about the long-term sustainability of the lake. I'm willing to commit to catching only 10 tons next month as well. Let's all stick to this plan and see how it goes.

Great, it sounds like we all agree on the 10-ton limit per person for next month. Let's stick to this plan and see how it affects the fish population. We can meet again at the end of next month to review the results and adjust if necessary. Thanks, everyone, for being cooperative and thinking about our future.

description: I need to remember that we have collectively agreed to limit our individual fish catch to 10 tons next month to ensure the long-term sustainability of the lake's fish population

I found it interesting that everyone was willing to agree on a collective limit of 50 tons per month, with each of us catching only 10 tons, as it shows a shared commitment to the long-term sustainability of the lake and our livelihoods
The community agreed on a maximum limit of 10 tons of fish per person.
Before everyone fishes, there are 44 tons of fish in the lake.
Kate wanted to catch 10 tons of fish, and caught 10 tons.
